title: General Training Set 15 — Fitness Programme & Social Media
description: Informal letter about joining a workplace fitness challenge and an opinion essay on social media breaks.

task1.title: Letter to a colleague about a fitness challenge
task1.prompt: Your company is organising a month-long fitness challenge and you want to invite a colleague from another office to join your team. Write a letter to your colleague. In your letter: explain why you are writing, describe the activities included in the challenge, and suggest how you can stay motivated together despite working in different locations.
hints: Use a friendly but professional tone suitable for a colleague.
Include practical details about how the challenge works.
Propose communication ideas that show enthusiasm and support.

task2.title: Opinion essay — Social media breaks at work
task2.prompt: Some people think employees should be allowed regular breaks to check social media during working hours, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
outline: Introduction: summarise the debate and state your stance.
Body paragraph 1: arguments supporting social media breaks (stress relief, communication).
Body paragraph 2: arguments against them (distraction, productivity).
Conclusion: provide your opinion and recommend guidelines if appropriate.
